TopicTitle: NavBall jumping when it changes to Night Mode? (Derp mode enabled; this is PBKAC problem - issue resolved)

Articles.Content:
Don't know the correct term - but when the altitude meter gets to the 'space' part of the slider, the navball goes from Blue Up to Black Up - what I call 'Night Mode'.

I've noticed on several flights now that the NavBall 'jumps' or rather my angle of attack gets suddenly flatter than it had under the previous animation.

Anyone else seeing this?

Edited January 6 by JoeSchmuckatelli
It's transitioning from Surface to Orbital reference direction vector.
Juuust like it was in KSP1.

9 minutes ago, JoeSchmuckatelli said:

Learn something new every day.

As they used to say at the end of GI Joe episodes, now you know, and knowing is half the battle.

There have been a lot of comments regarding the NavBall in KSP2.  Personally, I like how it changes appearance in the different reference modes, Surface, Orbital, and Target.  For me, it makes it more readily obvious which mode the NavBall is in.  The color scheme for Surface and Orbital looks good too.  The color scheme for Target mode is a little jarring to me though.
